titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Rogers Family Collection 1759-1993 MS 029 MS 029 MS 029
titlestmt.author: Processed by Ryan Bachman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-02-02 07:32:39 -0800.

did.abstract: This collection consists of documents relating to the Rogers family of Cornwall, principally Edward Rogers (1735-1813) as well as his brother Noah Rogers III (1731-1810) and several of their children and grandchildren.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: The collection is the product of several separate acquisitions by the Cornwall Historical Society. In the early 1990s, the various donations, purchases, and collected items were combined to form the current collection.

archdesc.userestrict:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Rogers Family Collection; MS 029; box number; folder number; Cornwall Historical Society

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This collection consists of documents relating to the Rogers family of Cornwall, principally Edward Rogers (1735-1813) as well as his brother Noah Rogers III (1731-1810) and several of their children and grandchildren. The two men were sons of Noah Rogers, Jr. (1688-1760) and originally from Branford, Connecticut. During the French and Indian War, Edward marched through the Cornwall area, and in 1760, he and his brother Noah moved to the community. The two brothers and their descendants were prominent farmers and businessmen in the community and were especially active in local military matters and religious life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The items relating to Edward Rogers provide unique information on farming in Cornwall, and due to his prominent status in community affairs, also shed light on Revolutionary War-era tax information and on local judicial proceedings. His livestock receipts involve business dealings with community members such as Jonathan Crocker, Samuel Butler Jr., Samuel Marble, and Jacob Cumming. The collection contains information on two of Edward’s sons, Anson and Edward, Jr., and on several generations of Noah’s descendants, namely: his son Noah IV; grandchildren Ambrose, Daniel L., and Noah V, and great-grandchildren, Henry L., Miner, Egbert, Dwight, and Mary E. Several individuals with unknown direct connections to the family are also included in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically by person/group then chronologically within each series.
The files are grouped into 5 series:
